alert.note: Alert for Lower Slopes of the Eastern Washington Cascades Crest (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 09 at 2:56PM PST until January 14 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST WEDNESDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING THROUGH LATE SATURDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...For the Blizzard Warning, blizzard conditions. Additional snow accumulations of 5 to 11 inches. Winds gusting as high as 65 mph. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 15 to 30 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 60 mph. * WHERE...Lower Slopes of the Eastern Washington Cascades Crest. * WHEN...For the Blizzard Warning, until 10 AM PST Wednesday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Thursday morning through late Saturday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Very strong winds could cause extensive tree damage. The cold wind chills as low as 20 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. The latest road conditions can be obtained for Oregon by calling 5 1 1 or by visiting online at https://tripcheck.com, or for Washington by visiting online at https://wsdot.com/travel.

area.areaDesc: Lower Slopes of the Eastern Washington Cascades Crest
